alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 10:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Lake Worth, Greenacres, Palm Springs, Lantana, Atlantis, Lake Clarke Shores, Lake Worth Corridor and Florida Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
